0xfff0.title: E-Stop Active Fault
possible_reasons: E-Stop pressed.
Large white iDrive connector unplugged.
Large white iDrive connector pin 7 disconnected.
iDrive power wire unplugged.
Scrub Controller board connector J9 pin 2 disconnected.
Scrub Controller board connector J8 unplugged.
Scrub Controller board connector J8 pin 7 disconnected.
possible_actions: Key off machine.
Press and reset E-Stop button.
Key on machine.
If fault persists, check harness connections between Estop and control module.
Replace or repair harness.
Replace E-STOP.

0x0501.title: Vacuum Motor Open Warning
possible_reasons: Wiring, connector or control board issue on the vacuum.
J10 connector on Scrub Controller board unplugged.
Scrub Controller board power disconnected.
Scrub Controller inline power fuse defective/blown.
possible_actions: Needs repair. Check connections. Board gets power from key switch and battery.

0x0712.title: EC-H2O Pump Breaker Tripped Warning
possible_reasons: Detected module circuit breaker trip.
Scrub Controller board J4 connector unplugged.
Scrub Controller board J4 connector pin 1 disconnected.
possible_actions: Power cycle machine. Check connections. If warning persists, contact service.

0x8001.title: Scrubbing feature disabled remotely
possible_reasons: Scrubbing feature has been disabled remotely by Tennant Admin
possible_actions: Contact Tennant Admin

0x8002.title: ABW feature disabled remotely
possible_reasons: ABW feature has been disabled remotely by Tennant Admin
possible_actions: Contact Tennant Admin

00.title: Charger Error
00.description: Triggered if a charger error is reported.
possible_reasons: The charger isn't working properly
possible_actions: Unplug your charger and plug it back in to restart it. Replace your charger.

nocharge.title: No Charge
nocharge.description: Triggered if machine reported usage but battery was not charged in that calendar day.
possible_reasons: The machine was used but not charged the same day.
possible_actions: Be sure to charge the machine after use at the end of a shift.

lowusage.title: Low Usage
lowusage.description: Triggered if the machine is used less than the user selected number of hours (defaults to 0 hours).
possible_reasons: The machine was used less than the user selected number of hours.
possible_actions: Change (decrease) the selected hours to be below your average usage time from the Setup.

relocation.title: Machine Relocated
relocation.description: Triggered if machine reported a location that is outside the set radius of its home location. This radius can be set by the user in the set-up page.
possible_reasons: The machine has been moved outside of its home radius.
possible_actions: Bring the machine within its home radius. Increase the distance of the allowable radius.

opportunitycharge.title: Opportunity Charge
opportunitycharge.description: The machine reported its battery being plugged in for charging but not to completion.
possible_reasons: The machine received a partial charge.
possible_actions: Be sure to charge the machine fully before unplugging. Partially charging a lead acid battery can shorten the life of the battery.

impactdetected.description: Triggered if machine detects a substantial impact. Check the machine for possible damage.

nocommunication.title: No Communication
nocommunication.description: Triggered if a machine has not communicated with the portal for the selected period.
possible_reasons: Poor cell coverage.
Battery if fully depleted.
Antenna or hardware component damaged.
possible_actions: Move the machine to a different location with better cell coverage.
Charge The battery.
Call Service for component replacement.

noserviceperformed.title: No Service Performed
noserviceperformed.description: Triggered if a machine has not been serviced in the selected period.
possible_reasons: Service has not been performed on the machine in the selected period.
possible_actions: Contact Tennant to perform service.
Adjust the time interval before service needs to be performed.

servicerequest.description: Triggered if a Service Request has been created or completed. A service request can be created by the IRIS system.

automaticbatterywatering.title: ABW TANK EMPTY
automaticbatterywatering.description: Triggered when Automatic Battery Watering (ABW) Tank needs to be filled with distilled water.
possible_reasons: Battery watering tank is empty.
Machine has had continued use with battery watering tank empty fault active (0x0B06).
possible_actions: Refill battery watering tank with distilled water then key cycle the machine.

maintenancereminder.title: MAINTENANCE REMINDER
maintenancereminder.description: Triggered if a machine reaches a threshold of cleaning hours.

T600E: Squeegee blades should be inspected for damage and proper deflection
Squeegee casters should be inspected for damage
Vacuum hose should be inspected for clogs or damage
Solution flow line and filter should be inspected for clogs and damage
Recovery tank drain hose should be inspected for clogs or damage
Pads or Brush Assembly should be inspected for wear and tear
Recovery tank lid seal should be inspected for damage
Debris tray should be inspected for clogs or damage
Squeegee assembly drip trap reservoir should be inspected for clogs
X4ROVR: Pads or Brush Assembly should be inspected for wear and tear
Side and rear Squeegee blades should be inspected for damage and proper deflection
Front/side 2D and 3D sensors and upper/lower LIDAR sensors should be inspected for damage and dirt
Left, right, and front Perimeter guards should be inspected for damage, debris and wear
Recovery tank drain hose should be inspected for clogs or damage
Recovery tank lid seal should be inspected for damage
Debris tray should be inspected for clogs or damage
Solution flow line and filter should be inspected for clogs and damage
Vacuum hose should be inspected for clogs or damage

T600E: Each squeegee blade has four wiping edges. Rotate the blades to an unused edge. If all four edges are worn, replace squeegee blades. Check squeegee blade deflection to the floor. Rear blade should deflect evenly across the full length of the squeegee at 45 degrees
Lubricate rear casters. If worn, replace rear casters
Flush vacuum hose. Check for damage and replace if damaged
Drain and rinse out the solution tank. Remove and clean solution tank filter
Check solution filter for damage and replace if damaged
Clean and flush recovery drain hose. Check for damage and replace if damaged
Replace Pads or Brush Assembly if worn or damaged
Flush Recovery Tank. Remove and clean the float shut-off screen
Clean recovery tank lid seal. Replace if damaged
Remove and clean debris tray. Replace if damaged
Remove the drip trap cover from the squeegee assembly and clean reservoir
X4ROVR: Replace Pads or Brush Assembly if worn or damaged

Each rear squeegee blade has two wiping edges. Rotate the blades to an unused edge. If all edges are worn, replace squeegee blades. Each side squeegee blade has four wiping edges. Rotate the blades to an unused edge. Once both edges are worn, swap squeegee blades from one side of the machine to the other to use the opposite edges. Replace blades when all edges are worn. Check squeegee blade deflection to the floor
Check for sensor damage. Clean with provided microfiber cloth. Replace if damaged
Replace damaged and/or worn perimeter bristle assemblies. Inspect adjustment plates for slipping. Adjust as necessary
Flush Recovery Tank. Remove and clean the float shut-off screen. Clean and flush recovery drain hose. Check for damage and replace if damaged
Clean recovery tank lid seal. Replace if damaged
Remove and clean debris tray. Replace if damaged
Drain and rinse out the solution tank. Remove and clean solution tank filter. Check solution filter for damage and replace if damaged
Flush vacuum hose. Check for damage and replace if damaged

notreachingcleantimegoals.title: NOT REACHING CLEAN TIME GOALS
notreachingcleantimegoals.description: Triggered if the machine is used less than the Clean Time Goal.
possible_reasons: The machine was used less than the Clean Time Goal that was set in the Setup page.
The expected clean time goal may be too high compared to actual usage patterns.
Operational downtime, maintenance, or holidays may have affected usage.
possible_actions: Adjust (decrease) the expected daily clean time goal to better match your machineâ€™s average usage.
Review machine schedules and ensure they align with expected usage goals.
